content.text: Multiple updates were made to the ElizaOS codebase, focusing on fixing typing errors, logical inconsistencies, and state reassignments. Several plugins, including plugin-quai, plugin-opacity, plugin-omniflix, and plugin-openai, received fixes to improve their functionality. Some fixes were partial due to unclear logic, requiring future refactoring.
Several merge operations were performed to integrate fixes into the develop branch, including updates for plugins such as plugin-sei, plugin-sgx, plugin-spheron, and plugin-starknet.

A patch was applied to fix an issue with the @coral-xyz 'BN' export in pnpm/@solana-developers. Additionally, a SYSTEM PROMPT hack was introduced to remove unwanted text elements from deepseek-chat model responses.
A series of spelling corrections were made across multiple files, including README.md and various scripts.

categories.title: Developments in AI: Privacy, Open Source, and Verifiable Inference

content.text: @ollama enables fully offline AI usage, allowing users to interact without concerns of surveillance or self-censorship. Investing in a powerful machine for self-hosted AI is seen as a step toward true digital freedom.
Self-hosted and open-source AI solutions, such as @ollama, provide privacy benefits and unlock new use cases based on personal data.
@IterIntellectus is optimistic about the future of open-source AI.

The @ai16zdao builder demo showcased several AI-driven projects, including:
- Book of Truth: AI-driven meme coin and GameFi platform
- 0R4CL3: AI-powered memory preservation tools
- MetaPumpAI: Real-time meme coin meta-analysis and token creation
- Automata: Modular AI systems with verifiable subagents
@UnslothAI successfully quantized the full version of DeepSeek R1, making it possible to run on an RTX 4090 with ~60GB of RAM, albeit with some quality loss.
A new documentation update introduces Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE) for Eliza, detailing its mathematical background, use cases in anonymous voting and consensus, and integration steps.
ElizaOS now integrates the Hash Network plugin for verifiable inference, ensuring tamper-proof records of AI-generated content using zkTLS and a Layer 3 Orbit Chain.

The cryptocurrency market has seen fluctuations in the prices of major assets. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) experienced a slight decline from $101,981.99 to $101,073.21. Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) also dropped from $3,180.26 to $3,076.30. Solana (SOL) saw a decrease from $234.94 to $226.94. Meanwhile, ai16z had a notable decline from $0.71 to $0.56.

categories.title: Security Updates and Feature Addition in ElizaOS

content.text: ElizaOS has updated the 'systeminformation' dependency to version 5.23.8 to address a security vulnerability (CVE-2024-56334). The vulnerability involved improper sanitization of SSID values, which could allow command injection on Windows systems. The update mitigates this risk by ensuring proper handling of SSID inputs.

ElizaOS has updated 'pnpm' to version 9.15.0 to address a security vulnerability (CVE-2024-53866). The issue involved mishandling of overrides and global cache, which could lead to unintended script execution across workspaces. The update ensures better isolation and security for package installations.

A new feature has been added to ElizaOS with the integration of the Lit Protocol plugin. This addition enhances key management by enabling Lit Agent Wallet functionality, allowing for controlled delegation of tasks and policies for agents. The update is considered low risk and does not require changes to project documentation.
A fix was implemented to remove a build warning in the abstract package.json file. This change is categorized as an improvement and does not require documentation updates.
Changes were made to allow package scoping to be set to public. This update was committed and also submitted as a pull request.
A placeholder pull request titled 'pull req (delete this)' was created but does not contain meaningful content.
An update titled 'Updated eliza changes' was submitted, but no additional details were provided.

categories.title: Enhancements in Price Fetching and Arbitrage Optimization

content.text: Updated the price fetching mechanism by replacing the fetch method with axios, which supports automatic proxy settings. Additionally, support for two types of private keys has been introduced: 'suiprivatekeyxxxxx' strings and seed words.
Improvements in arbitrage functionality, including better gas price optimization and volume calculation. Additionally, the logging system has been updated to use 'elizaLogger'.

categories.title: Recent Feature Requests and Enhancements for ElizaOS

content.text: A feature request has been made to expose various runtime configuration parameters, such as lore count, post example count, bio count, and conversation length, via configuration settings. The request also suggests documenting these parameters thoroughly and potentially adding configuration options for chunk size and bleed in knowledge processing.

A new feature request proposes adding a prefill prompt field in the character.json configuration file to support prefill capabilities offered by providers like Anthropic and GoogleAI. This would allow for more optimized and accurate responses by leveraging provider-specific prefill features.

A new model provider for LM Studio has been added to ElizaOS. This feature allows users with AMD RyzenAI hardware to run models locally without requiring workarounds. The implementation includes configuration updates and testing steps to integrate LM Studio as a model provider.

A new plugin has been introduced to enable trading on Orderly Network. This plugin allows users to deposit, withdraw, and trade assets through Orderly Network, with minimal risk as it only interacts with the network. Users can register an account and perform trading actions via the chat interface.
@ai16zdao was fair launched on @daosdotfun.
A project is undergoing a comprehensive rebranding initiative as it expands across multiple countries, develops core technology, and fosters a strong builder community.
A discussion on open-source software highlights that most tools used for coding and application development are open source.

categories.title: Merge and Revert Updates in Plugin Testing

content.text: The 'develop' branch was merged into 'tests/plugin-asterai' to incorporate recent changes.
A previous commit related to test configuration and coverage for the 3D generation plugin was reverted.

categories.title: Twitter Post Enhancements and Fixes in ElizaOS

content.text: The `generateNewTweet` function in `client-twitter/src/post.ts` was previously retrieving all character topics for knowledge retrieval, leading to repetitive first posts and predictable topic-based knowledge retrieval. To improve variation, entropy has been introduced by shuffling and sampling topics before retrieval.

The `{{maxTweetLength}}` template tag does not exist in the tweet post template, causing issues in tweet composition. A potential fix could involve passing custom inputs into `composeContext` or directly populating `maxTweetLength` before sending data to `composeContext`. The issue is open for discussion to align with Eliza's architecture.
Additional data is now included when scraping tweets, improving the quality and completeness of retrieved information.
